title: Drawing, ca. 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache on off-white paper
inscribed: Inscribed on the verso in graphite in a nineteenth century hand: Fontainbleau / Appartement du  Roi / Grand Cabinet á La suite de celui du Conseil; in Decloux's hand: Fay / T311
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: An elevation of a wall.  At the center, an arch rising from a dado, is flanked by two folding doors with decorative panels.  The arch is lined inside by a draped curtain.  A chandelier is suspended at the center of the arch.  A panel with a painting is placed above each door.  The scenes in the paintings show Prudence and Justice.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache on off-white paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-155.
